data.event: Its toponimc name Entroncamento literally mean junction, owing to being the junction of the two railway lines that developed in 1864: the Linha do Norte (Northern Line) and the Linha do Leste (Eastern Line).

event.title: Hinged between its links with the east and Beira Baixa, the station at Entroncamento, for many decades

data.event: Hinged between its links with the east and Beira Baixa, the station at Entroncamento, for many decades, was the obligatory stop that moved goods and people to the north and east.

event.title: became frequent visitors both before and after the 25 April

data.event: Political leaders also became frequent visitors both before and after the 25 April Revolution, such as Jo√£o Chagas, politician and journalist, who travelled to Lisbon in order to assume the direction of the new government, after the dictatorship of General Pimenta de Castro.

event.title: a long time, the two settlements were divided

data.event: For a long time, the two settlements were divided between two neighbouring municipalities, because the rail-line itself determined its boundary.

event.title: the development of rail transport and support structures, later the installation of military quarters

data.event: The small settlement continued to growing, owing to the development of rail transport and support structures, later the installation of military quarters (after 1916) determined the geographic accessibility, resulting in further influx of families.

The small settlement continued to growing, owing to the development of rail transport and support structures, later the installation of military quarters (after 1916) determined the geographic accessibility, resulting in further influx of families.
